website_summaries.verdict: This cordless option handles trimming and edging, and has a guard to keep flower beds intact while in use.
pros: Dual-position wheels adjust for grass trimming and edging
Toolless conversion from one function to the other
12-inch cutting diameter with instant line feeding
Quick-release lever makes height adjustments easy
Flower spacer guard protects plants and vegetation
cons: Not enough power for thicker growth or more demanding jobs

website_summaries.verdict: This weed eater has a lot of functions that help its 2 modes work well.
pros: 2-in-1 power tool has dual-position wheels to support grass trimming and edging
Tool-free conversion from in-line edger to trimmer
Comes with 2 20V cordless Max lithium power batteries
Quick-release lever makes it easy to make height adjustments with the telescoping shaft
cons: Command Feed requires manually pulling the line

customer_reviews.title: Warning. This product does not work well or as described.
customer_reviews.text: This edger is not very good. It’s awkward in its design and feels like it’s backwards. When I wrote the company they said it was normal to operate this way. The auto feed button is also a piece of junk and never works. Don’t buy this product and don’t believe the reviews. I can not recommend it after using it for eight months. I wish I could return it. I really don’t like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money for even light use.
customer_reviews.text: 12 Minutes of light weed wacking on a fully charged battery, shuts off let it rest for 5 minutes and you get another 2 or 3 minutes of run time. I had trimmed my lawn 3 days ago and it couldn't handle more than 12 minutes of use, so it wasn't heavy trimming at all. Piece of junk is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Wurm

customer_reviews.title: Good for someone older who is finding gas power line trimmers too heavy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Being now older and it's getting more difficult to use the gas power trimmers around the many trees in my rural yard .. I have to say this is a good alternative here (it's much lighter .. and the handle is comfortable enough for even me with arthritis in my hands .. ) The run time could be longer (But again .. living rurally, I have more land) I am pleased so far .. just wish the spool line was a bit longer so I don't have to change spools so often (since I keep things trimmed up .. it's just grass this is used for .. I would not use this on woodier brush)
customer_reviews.author: An Empty-Nester

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This item is a complete waste of money! Battery life is basically nonexistent. Followed the charging instructions to the letter. Batteries would die within minutes. I’m not eligible to return this item, because I waited to long to unbox it and use it. So it’s throwing $85 out the window.. Normally Amazon is easy to return items with.. I’m frustrated with the fact I have tried to use this item 3 diffident times and each time it’s failed to trim my grass in a very small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wagner

customer_reviews.title: A total piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I almost never leave reviews but it felt irresponsible to not leave feedback on this piece of junk. I used this weed wacker about three times. Not that easy to manever, and didn't do a great job but easier than pulling pavement crack weeds by hand. On the fourth time using it plastic material essential to the function of this piece of garbage just cracked off. There is a limited warranty but you have to pay shipping charges both ways. Buying this piece of junk is like throwing money in the garbage pail.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Oakland CA

customer_reviews.title: I should've gotten this from day 1.
customer_reviews.text: My neighbors might or might not know.. but I secretly compete with them on who can keep their lawn looking sharp, tidy and on point... This tool right here does the job and makes all the difference. I like it! I like it alot!
customer_reviews.author: ivanrbustillos

customer_reviews.title: Battery life rocks; Wire spools do not
customer_reviews.text: The battery life, even with the weakest batteries they sell, is phenomenal. The bad news is that the wire spools stink. Not literally - they smell fine. But they are tiny. Like, really small with very little wire. I bought a 6-pack of spools and went through 2 in a day. On my old school weed whacker, I went through 2-3 in a year. I can respect business plans that rely on parts & maintenance as the hidden cash cow, but geez.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Maniac Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming from an electric trimmer from a quality company and this doesn't come close. Weak and short lived battery makes it basically good for almost nothing useful. I had a battery trimmer 13 years ago and judging from the reviews on this one I thought they'd improved since then. Obviously they haven't. This is worse than the one I had way back then.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gress

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to buy, and install your own durable quality cord line.
customer_reviews.text: The provided spoiled cord is cheap, and not durable. You must provide, and install heavier gauge, durable line. Otherwise, edging properly is not possible. Their cheap line will not cut through compacted soil. Buy a real metal wheeled device for crisp, true edging. The 2 battery packs, each last about a half hour, or one full hour of use, (although the are described to last longer, 45 min. each). The provided paper manual for operating is inadequate with description detail, and relies on vague pictures, particularly to the adjustment of the Shield. However, once past these drawbacks, it appears well constructed, and functions well, including the ease of by Command feed for the release of Line from the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the job.
customer_reviews.text: There are some nice design features and it's great not having the hassle of an electric cord, however, it's just not up to the task of mowing down weeds. I think this might be due not so much to being underpowered, as having a too flimsy string. Although it is .065 in diameter, it is very flexible. See photo to see how the string has curled resulting in very little cutting surface. Sadly, I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for small yards.
customer_reviews.text: The good: - Comes with 2 batteries - Mobility is impressive - Compatability allows for easy storage - Good for small yards The not so good: - Battery life is roughly 10-15 minutes - Lacks power to tackle anything larger than small weeds Verdict: - Recommend for those with small yards - Don't expect power to be comparable to a gas powered unit
customer_reviews.author: william nave

customer_reviews.title: Impressed by this weedeater/trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough for this older lady to set up and use. My adult nephew who is 6' tall was cynical until he tried it. Now I don't have anything to trim or weed because he has done all of it. We are both impressed with how well it works! I would highly recommend this trimmer/weedeater!
customer_reviews.author: Marilegal304

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not so great. Also the original line it comes with is ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well for edging. Battery life is not so great. Also the original line it comes with is too soft and kept breaking inside the spool forcing me to take it apart and run the line thru the line hole. I respooled it with a stronger line I bought from the store and now it works with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: JQG

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised and would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought the combo and they both work great. The blower has a good amount of power but only lasts about 15 minutes on the highest setting so I've found myself moving a little quicker when using it. The weed eater has been great in both normal and edger positions. I have a corner lot and the battery has lasted through edging around the house and most of the sidewalk so I'm pretty happy. All in all, I would recommend both products.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A good trimmer with poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: I like most of the Worx tools. I have five of them now and I am satisfied with all of them. That said, they all came with terrible instruction sheets. There are several pages of warnings in type so small as to make reading difficult. Then there are several pages of drawn pictures that are supposed to show you how to assemble the various parts. The tools work fine, but the instruction manuals do not. Thus, I take off one star.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS A HIDAY

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for Edging, not Whacking.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous tool. I purchased for edging my lawn again concrete driveway/sidewalk. Does a great job without tearing up my concrete. Previously used a bladed edger which would spark or take bits out of the concrete. Batteries last well, and I thought the string lasted a lot long than a gas weedwhacker. I did try to use this for regular weedwhacking of tall grass, but it couldn't bite through it. Great as an edger which is fine with me. Loved the wheel and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Great edger, not so great as weed trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best edger I've ever had! It's light and edges well. However, two things take away from it as a "weed whacker." First trying to switch from the edger to the weed eater is a real challenge. It would help if you have 3 legs and 3 arms. The head is really hard to move, and trying to do a balancing act while standing on the cutter itself in the grass and pulling up on the handle is a real trick. Secondly, the wire guide is pretty useless and will not remain in place, no matter where you put it. Still, overall this is a good product for the majority of the work I require.
customer_reviews.author: Bookdigester

customer_reviews.title: All the easy to use FEATURES, trimmer head adjustment, line feed, length, and the Lithium Batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Trimmer Head adjusts very easy, line feed is easy to get used to, you can do line feed, just by squeezing the trigger, every time you turn it on, line feeds 1/4" which is a really neat feature, or you can do it by pressing a button, or manually. Length is another easy to adjust feature, and the Battery charge is good for 20-25 mins. Speed is great, I had 3 gas trimmers, before, speed was always too fast, full speed on the Worx is just right. I would highly recommend this, Trimmer, I'm 78, this Trimmer is EASY to use, and I have 2 bad shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well on my yard. I am still getting the feel of using it as an edger.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli H

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. each battery last 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times, so far so good .each battery last 20 minutes, have 2 so it's fine by me .each battery takes 5 hours to recharge, but I'm in no big rush .
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Fine for Lawns ... but nowhere near the power of 2-cycle (gas-powered) versions
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my wife and daughter weren't comfortable using my 2-Stroke-Gas-Powered same. Is more versatile than my gas-version but isn't balanced when operating and bogs-down when the grass gets thick (as opposed to gas-version which blasts right thru). So if I had to say anything this trimmer and edger does more (I like the simple edging conversion) and is easier for my family to handle ... but only has power for easy trimming (lawns). I also like the 6 spools from Worx for what they call handling/shipping (roughly $10 ... but still a lot cheaper than buying same or trying to wrap new line on the spool).
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy string keeps breaking
customer_reviews.text: The string life is 6 feet!!! Ugh. Then I have to extend it again. It is so annoying. I bought .08 size string and this one too, breaks in half after 12 feet. I just bought a different one online, metal blade after using this trimmer for 3 weeks. I already spent so much time on it, from reading reviews to watching videos. It is not worth my time anymore. String keeps on breaking. I tried everything. Different ways to hold it, not touching concrete etc
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Buy Buy Buy
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other then WOW! I will definitely try other products by this manufacturer. I have had a plug in rechargeable wacker and this one puts it to shame. The fact that I have 2 chargers and a charging station is always a plus. The only time I had a problem with it was when I tried to cut a cockabur about 1.5" around in girth. I lost the string and had to restring but that was so simple to do. Back up and running in a couple minutes. It's adjustability for a person statue is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: M. Waltman

customer_reviews.title: How low can Worx go ?
customer_reviews.text: A very poor tool. Feels like it made of the cheapest plastic. Manual is hard to comprehend. Haven’t worked with it yet because it needs it own unique cartridge of wire, unlike the tools in this category which can be fed by standard wires. Also, it needs a special battery which is different from other Worx batteries of the same line (power share)!!! I wait now for the special spool they sell, and see what happens. But in general, You better shrewd your money than buy Worx garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: Miki

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service from WORX
customer_reviews.text: The first charger I received was malfunctional but WORX customer service was great and sent me a new one immediately. This is a great product! Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After my Stihl corded trimmer broke and was non-repairable according to the factory repair people I decided to look elsewhere for a trimmer. Took a chance on the works trimmer/edger and could not be happier. It is not going to chop thru a forest but works very well on trimming the edges of my lawn. Flip it over and the edger with the wheels attached make beautiful edging lines. Light weight, adjustable and easy to use. Good battery life and easy to charge when necessary. Happy camper....
customer_reviews.author: mick coleman

customer_reviews.title: nice trimmer
customer_reviews.text: After moving to Texas... where summertime is like living on the surface of the sun... and ethanol separates from gasoline in what seems like just a few days... I decided my lifetime of using gas-powered small engines was over. My son told me his neighbor likes his Worx tools, so when I saw this for under $90, I figured I couldn't go too wrong. I've used it for almost a year now with no issues. The line feeds well, and it's comfortable to use. I'm glad it comes with two batteries though, because even on my little spit of land (1/8 acre), I can't get through it with just one battery.
customer_reviews.author: buyer-wxy

customer_reviews.title: Very Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and easy to maneuver. I have a much more powerful battery operated string trimmer, but it's twice as heavy. Being a women of a certain age, lighter is better. It seems made of cheap plastic but that's the trade off for a light weight product. Although this is not as powerful as my other string trimmer, it does the job in most cases. If using in tall thick grass, it may have problems . It works well as an edger on vinca minor.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: So, being a 20V trimmer I had low expectations for its usable power. I am impressed with this weedeater. SUPER lightweight (maybe 3 lbs) and plenty of power for use around the house. We own a large lot in the country. We did use both batteries to complete it (close to an hour), but that's about what I expected. Keep in mind, the charging time estimate is 5 hours and I find it to be very accurate. Not strong enough for commercial use, but for property owners this thing does the job.
customer_reviews.author: A F&T

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life. Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great for smaller yard. Auto feed of string is great. Battery life is good. Ability to use as an edger is awesome. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Typical Cheesy Weed Eater
customer_reviews.text: I must be hell on weed eaters. I go thru them one after the other. My main issue is that I have a bad shoulder so a gas powered one is way too heavy. This particular weed eater I sent back after the first use. The battery was barely enough to get me 15 min around the first part of my yard. Little power. I ended up returning this and went to Lowes and bought another brand which doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles but it does what it should so far. I am a 68 year old woman, fyi.
customer_reviews.author: crazy_reader

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to order one of these for quite awhile now. My husband passed last year and we have not one, but three gas powered weed trimmers out in our garage...but......unfortunately I don't have the "umpth" needed to start any one of these. I recently ordered this, and I just love it!!! It's lightweight, easy to start, and does have a long battery life per battery usage. The only complaint (or lack there of) would be...I wish that the starter buttons you didn't have to continually hold, my hand gets tired after awhile....just saying. ALL in all...........I'm so happy I ordered this. Now I am going to purchase the blower!!! M :)
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Worx Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Craftsman gas trimmer that lasted all of 3 seasons. I have now used it to trim and edge my yard. It didn't even use one of the two batteries to complete both jobs. It is easy to use, pretty versatile and barely weighs a thing. Giant bonus, I went to buy replacement string from the Worx website and, guess what, free for life. I had to pay shipping (a whopping $8.97) for 6 reels of string. I am very happy with the trimmer and am looking at replacing my Worx Corded Blower with a battery share model.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: Part of Share Power!
customer_reviews.text: Does great and both edging & weed eating! I love the power share system so my collection of Worx products is growing. Easy to use, battery powered & not horribly loud.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Consumes trimmer line very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The trimer unit itself is very good for light duty. The trimmer would get 5 stars on its now. The problem is the trimmer line spools are so small you run out of line very quickly. I only have about 8-10 minutes of trimming to do per mowing and I will sometimes run out of a full spool of line in 10 minutes (and I rarely press the feed button). Frustrating to have to re-spool line almost every time I use it. I went with electric over gas for the perceived low maintenance of the electric, but re-spooling every time is more frustrating than the difficulties posed by my gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Remarc1

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but you will be constantly refilling the spool
customer_reviews.text: It is a fine string trimmer, battery lasts long and there are two so one is always ready. The biggest drawback is that the little 2" spool empties constantly, which means stopping work and sitting for 20 minutes to re-wind string onto it. The auto-feed button seems to have stopped working during the first use of the trimmer. Also, the wheels were not included in the box,so I emailed Worx and they are sending me a new wheel assembly, though its been a week and they're not here yet. My advice, find one with a full-sized spool that only needs to be changed every few weeks instead of every hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: nope
customer_reviews.text: the string spool keep coming out and the strip breaks off...frustrating..now the wheels came off somesher and i cant them
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality do not waste your money !
customer_reviews.text: Yeah it works and yes lightweight however the line and automatic feed do not work. It never works from the start and it was such a hassle to keep going in there trying to pull out the string every minute. sometimes the Will fly off and then you have to spoil the entire thing together again it’s a very cheap strange it lasts for such a short time and then the button doesn’t work. This is such a hassle the other features are not even worth it. Such a disappointment and such a hassle to return such a huge item . I would not buy this again and I would not recommend this the quality is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight trimmer. It is light in weight, in capacity for trimming, in battery life. It was very easy to put together. The wheels were awkward for me so I took them off. One battery lasted thru half my 3/4 acre yard; I have a lot of trees and shrubs, flowering plants to cut around. The trimmer does not advance enough string to suit my cutting needs. The amount of string did last through 2 trimmings of my yard. I wanted lightweight and that is what I got, lightweight. Now I realize I need a trimmer that is a little more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Line always breaks inside spool
customer_reviews.text: This is a multifunctional device and it works well until the line breaks. It always gets tightly wound inside the spool and does not properly extend line. I have to get out a screwdriver to manually unwind and extend the line. I’m following instructions so not sure what else to do. It has a button to auto extend line but the spool seems to be the problem.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Light weight workhorse. Comes with 2 batteries, ended up getting 2 more along with a fast charger, because I was also using this at my church too and the 2 batteries get only through about 3 hours of my driveway, sidewalk and trimming. The head tilting is too stiff and I am afraid I'll break it, but oh my, can this do the job! Get extra string, along with the caps, because you will be going to town! Out of all the ones I've had, gas, electric and battery, I find this one to be the easiest, most lightweight, efficient and durable!
customer_reviews.author: scouter9922

customer_reviews.title: Finally one I can operate
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple of gas trimmers that are too heavy for me and I am continually sitting down to replace the line that is always breaking. This trimmer is a lighter weight and the cord doesn't break nearly as much. If it does usually I can just feed some back out which I was never able to do on the gas trimmers. All of that makes it much faster for me to trim. My yard looks so much neater now! This trimmer is perfect for me! Plus Worx sent me refills for just the shipping cost. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: HCS

customer_reviews.title: Could be Stronger
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am satisfied with this product with the exception of the following: Battery life is not long. However, two batteries is a plus. Secondly, the motors power is lacking in thick areas and drains battery substantially. Good value for the money, but you may need to look elsewhere if your in need of decent power.
customer_reviews.author: Coal

customer_reviews.title: Light weight for older people to handle! Simple to adjust!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Worx weed eater and I love them! This is more modernized than the other 3 but simpler for me being older! Edger and weed eater in one! Also, like lifetime string!! I would encourage anyone who enjoys their yard/flowerbeds to try one of these!! I had a problem though. It was to come with 2 batteries and one charger. It came with 1 battery and 2 chargers. One charger has no cord. Am guessing they grabbed the wrong one that was defective? I need another battery, please!! Also, where do I go to order free string??
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. For the price i love this gadget. Worx really designs great products. I like how it cuts and does edging. Its easy to transition from 1 to the other. I like the string feed button. Convenient. The trimmer could use more power. Takes a bit of effort to cut through tall weeds and grass. The battery life is kinda short but you get 2 batteries. This trimmer is perfect for a Small yard. I use this for my parkway and sidewalk. Works fine. 2 Batteries last long enough to finish the job
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Second opinion afetr giving it some thought
customer_reviews.text: Have used this grass trimmer all summer and I thought it was time for my review..... the engineering is good, the batteries last fairly long, and the workmanship is good.... BUT I'm not satisfied with the overall performance..... it feel more like a toy than a tool....just doesn't do the job as well as I expected....Sorry Worx I have decided to upgrade my rating of this trimmer...... reason being is the "edger" feature..... it is easy to set up and works great for this job also the string is free and it is easy to replace these small spools.......I'm changing to a 5 star for these just mentioned features...Worx 4 me
customer_reviews.author: Fearnofishbob

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer started falling apart. I found the front side piece in my yard and upon further searching I found the trimmer cap (the part that holds the spool) in another section of the yard. So without the trimmer cap to hold the spool in place the line does not feed and the trimmer is useless. I am only trimming the yard so this equipment should not be falling apart. It did not even make it one summer. Very disappointment and angry.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect any support from Worx
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that came with my Worx weed-wacker were not very clear, and their you-tube videos were less so, so I called the support line and a folksy recording came on telling me to e-mail my problem. It was 19 days before I got a response!! That’s unacceptable. I was really disappointed in the company.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Super trimmer-edger and a great value
customer_reviews.text: I am 59 years old and have never operated a string trimmer. I got this one because it also did edging and reviews said it was lightweight. The written use instructions are pitiful, but there are plenty of how-to videos online, which were very helpful. The batteries took five hours apiece to charge, but so what. I just tried it for the first time and it works amazingly. It’s very simple to convert from edger to trimmer and back again once you figure out how it works. It’s powerful and not that noisy and very lightweight. I just did a ton of edging and trimming in my front yard and I can’t wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: CindyofAngels

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer and Edger
customer_reviews.text: I Love this Trimmer and Edger. I have a cheap one I've purchased from Walmart, god that Trimmer used to make my hand hurt like crazy. This Trimmer is like playing with a toy. It fits my small hands perfectly and it's not heavy. it's pricey but now that I've seen the difference I've regretted not purchasing this a long time ago. It is money well spent. The only issue, is the Trimmer line. The trimmer line is out of order on their website and on amazon is very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was extremely easy to get used to and on the second go round, I felt like a pro. The edging feature with wheels makes crisp edging along driveway and walkways. Battery life was surprisingiy long as I was able to do the entire lawn on one charge. The second battery is a great feature, just in case! My neighbor has one and I was able to try it before I bought it - light weight, maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: blacksmith

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband does most of the yardwork, but, 'occasionally' my OCD kicks in and I just need to tidy things up (his macho, gas powered trimmer is to bulky and heavy for me). This is just perfect for me, battery lasts long enough to take care of business, but does get a bit heavy and the hand gets crampy from holding it on (I'm an old lady of 72 LOL). But, even better, the other day, hubby decided to give it a try and he totally enjoyed using it. So, I'd highly recommend this for anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, great if it worked as designed
customer_reviews.text: Wheel keeps falling off while edging. Auto string feed stopped feeding!! Super annoying!! If you can keep everything working it's actually a pretty handy little unit for edging. Of course it was 10 days past the return window when things started malfunctioning, so I guess I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trimmer/Edger!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a set of three with the Worx lawn mower and blower. After a year now, they are all three still working very well. The mower has a nice turbo feature for the long stuff this time of year, but it also does drain the battery faster too. The blower is fun, super light, super powerful. The trimmer/edger works very well. Good value for this set of three. Good battery life too. Only one time did we run out of juice on four lawns, after using turbo for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Super short battery life, otherwise a great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The provided batteries don't even last 20 minutes on a full charge, that's my main complaint, and the reason I returned this trimmer. It was powerful enough for a small trimmer, so if you have a tiny yard, you might be happy. The wheel attachment makes it super easy to put a nice clean edge on a lawn. Just not what I was expecting (maybe 30-40 min per battery?). I'm sticking with my corded electric trimmer until I can justify buying a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: David Baughman

customer_reviews.title: I really like this tool.
customer_reviews.text: While I have only used this over the last few weeks, I have found it to be light weight, which is great since I am old now, easily managed, is amazingly powerful, has a very nice line extension button, the battery lasts as long as I need it in my small garden. I like the way the head can be set at different angles to reach under things and use to trim my line of ivy trees vertically. I like that I can extend the shaft. So so far, I find its a great tool and solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: adaptability
customer_reviews.text: I've had this trimmer for a week and took it for the longest test run yesterday. I love it! Our yard is an acre and I went crazy edging the driveway, the sidewalk, patio stones, the boulevard, garden beds, landscaping, and more. When I needed to trim the grass, I just flipped it around. Very easy and light and effective. Ran out of string at one point (had half a roll to begin with) and plopped in another, easy and quick. I even switched out batteries once - another quick and easy process if you have a fresh one ready. It's actually more fun than work, so I see a fun summer ahead ... and a lovely yard bonus! Win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I have used many cord trimmers, gas, electric, and battery powered. This is my favorite trimmer. True, gas and the plug in electrics are more powerful but this lite weight trimmer gets the job done. Its many features also provide for a better job than the others. Weighing less than six pounds makes any job easier and more comfortable to do. Attaching the wheel makes edging simple and precise. Even putting in new cutting string is easy. The cutting string seems to be lasting longer than my previous trimmers which I think is due to being able to make trimming precise. The included instructions are rather dismal though and takes a bit of thought to understand them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Womack

customer_reviews.title: It looked fine but when I put it together the handle would ...
customer_reviews.text: This item came from Amazon warehouse damaged. It looked fine but when I put it together the handle would not lock into place. Contacted Worx and they sent me a whole new Trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: The online videos are accurate. Great product for small to mid-size jobs.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - The tool comes almost completely assembled. Just need to attach the wheels. - It is light and easy to maneuver. - No noise (battery operated). - Very good cutting power. - WORX provide a "Spools For Life" where you only pay S&H. Make sure you take advantage of that! CONS: - Just a consideration. Not a problem necessarily... Depending on the size of your yard and the size of the battery pack you have, you may either need another battery or a larger capacity one. With the smaller battery, for my needs I am getting around 45-60 mins of use. Works well for me. Summary: Great tool, minimum noise and adequate power for most needs. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: First Battery Powered Week wacker
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buy a 2nd battery to charge while using .. My first electric weed wacker.. Purchased for my smaller yard.. The battery life will only last about for 30×40 sq yrs.. More than enough for my uses.. The only issue is the extension clamp isnt strong enough to squeeze the inner and outter aluminum. Tubing tight so they dont move .. Every once in a while you have to stop and adj... * Doesn't come with extra Line *
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for a lightweight set of machines
customer_reviews.text: We have been pleased as the added convenience of these light weight alternatives to gas and corded which we also have. The battery life is just good enough for the hedges and bushes that we need to trim. My wife and I just love the convenience of the portable blower, just so quick and easy without dragging out cords. String trimmer works adequately but may be better for smaller properties. While recovering from back surgery, the lighter weight implements have been much appreciated and also avoid the potential mess with gas, oil and exhaust of the higher power models which may be appropriate more for larger properties.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Steinmetz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Works mower and weed wacker/edger! It works amazing! Batter life is perfect! Multiple handle positions. Adjustable length for your highth. (On that note, I am 5'6". This is great for my height. If ur taller than me you may have to bend to use this). The edge is amazing with the wheels, take some time learning where the wire hits and it will do great. I was sceptical of electric tools but they have made AMAZING strides in battery life and power!!! I had a dewalt electric one before and it had much more power than this one but... I think it had to much power. 1 slip and an entire section of grass is gone lol
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it works pretty good. If you made the switch from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Let's get to the missing star. It's because it has a single string, that's all. Other than that it works pretty good. If you made the switch from a gas powered weed whacker you may be unimpressed but in the end it does what I need it to do. The duel batteries is a huge plus, no down time for big jobs and they charge quickly. It's very light compared to a gas powered one and it's easy to handle. I have not used the curb trimmer feature so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Norman B.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this weed eater. Having two batteries is a must if you're doing more than just the perimeter of your house, just a word of advice. Makes edging a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra B.

customer_reviews.title: Voted #1 weed eater in the Nation!
customer_reviews.text: We have had the old /original Worx weed eater for year,The 18V batteries were the only issue I had with it. Walla! They come out with the 20V model! Super happy! Should get another 10 years out of this one! Worx is the brand to buy you won't be sorry you did:-)
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I came back to edit review initial review i put one star because im a moron the to think the batteries would come charged....well they dont and dont mistake the charge light as well flashing green is charging solid green is charged there is no red blinking light while its charging to full to turn green ....green to green. At full charge o got roughly 20 min out of a battery and thats non stop not letting off the trigger . its a work horse and performs very well. I got tired of gas weed eaters i have horrible luck with them i get one good year and a part or something dumb goes bad.
customer_reviews.author: savage

customer_reviews.title: Love this weedeater!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness! Love this weedeater. So much more lightweight thn a bulky gas weedeater and no cord to drag around like an electric weedeater. Battery powered is the way to go! Lightweight, easy to handle, long lasting battery and still gets the job done with ease! Love that it comes with 2 batteries so I can charge 1 while using the other. My husband thinks I am weird because I enjoy weedeating!
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Worx trimmer for years. Bought this one as a replacement. I did have an issue with the handle lock slipping but I contacted Worx and they replaced it with no trouble at all. I have arthritis in my wrists and can not hold any tool for long but the wheels take care of that. I have concrete edging around all my flower beds and all I do is set the wheels on the curbing and run the trimmer around getting a crisp professional edging. I also use it in tight places where I can't get with my mower and it does a great job there as well. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: mrscott

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power for suburbia!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the 20v version - it has plenty of power for my suburban needs. Having used weed whackers in the past to clear brush/heavy weeds on a country lot, I have an appreciation for why more power is a plus. After considering my current need (1/3 acre suburban lot), and the price difference for replacement batteries...I took a gamble that the 20v would be all I need. I just gave it a trip around the yard and I am very pleased, I took it through a couple of overgrown spots and it didn't have any trouble whacking everything down. Happy, happy, happy! No more extension cord!!
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Lady

customer_reviews.title: WORX Trimmer: Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Trimmer seemed to work okay, trimmer line seemed to be flimsy. We we unable to register product WG163.8 GT on WORX website, After many attempts to register we called WORX customer service and spoke to a CSR who was rude, abrupt and unhelpful. If a product isn't registered customer loses at least 1 year of extended warranty. Since WORX doesn't care we had to return item.
customer_reviews.author: CHAMELEON

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lightweight Edger
customer_reviews.text: This edger/trimmer is extremely powerful and easy to handle. I used it the day I received it and did my entire yard! It cut nice clean edges with little effort on my part. I had purchased a Toro lightweight edger and it was great the first few times I used it, then the line kept breaking because the mechanism wouldn't turn. Apparently, this is a common problem with the Toro so it found its' way into the bulk trash. If this edger continues to perform as it has thus far, I will be thrilled. I needed a light weight efficient edger for front and back lawn. I found it! I love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: windsale

customer_reviews.title: Works but Package is a TOTAL Fail
customer_reviews.text: The item works as intended.... but note... there is a reason it is this cheap... it comes with 2 amp batteries not 4 amp... and the insulting part is that it only comes with a single charger... so you can only charge one battery at a time... seriously... for something that comes with 2 batteries you should really provide a dual charger... so add $23 to the price for the extra charger you will need... If I would have realized this upfront... I would have saved by just buying the tool with NO batteries and bought the 4 amp batteries with a dual charger... this way I could use it in my worx mower and blower as well...
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tabone

customer_reviews.title: that battery though. .
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't last very long at all, we have a small yard, and the thing overheats too much and causes us to cool off at least twice during the initial yardwork. i thought i bought the long-lasting capacity battery but this one is just awful. it makes me have to stop work in the middle of the groove so often. . bummer. i like getting things done in 1 or 2 swoops, not 4 or 6. i'd understand it completely if our yard was much bigger, but our space is so small a car would not be able to park on it fully. it's ridiculous, but it DOES cut easily. We just greatly despise the battery performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jaguar Jessie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. It is very light and easy to maneuver, and the adjustable length is tremendous because I use it mostly on a hill that the lawnmower can't tackle. It hammers through some fairly tough growth for 45 minutes of continuous operation with some battery life to spare (this is between twi batteries; I need to swap out the first battery after about 25 minutes). As other reviewers have mentioned, it is tough to get it into n upright position--you need to step on it hard and crank up strongly, and I was pretty sure I would break it in so doing, but it finally popped into place and did not break.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lees

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cost 👍
customer_reviews.text: Love it for the price! Light weight, extends and retractable for easy storage. Good thing it comes with 2 batteries, seems to go fast, but again I have owned a battery operated one prior and it went fast,so may just be with weed eaters.
customer_reviews.author: anthony terrazas

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to spend more than 100 on a weed wacker. After researching battery system I decided against dewalt even though it was my top choice because their 20v batteries are expensive and I already have their 12v system. Anyways this has great feature that I wanted and the price combined with 2 batteries is a solid deal. Performance was better than expect, ive never used a battery system for lawn tool. This thing has good power and I easily trimmed 2 smaller side yards with ease. Really happy with Worx and I’ll be buying more lawn stuff for their system
customer_reviews.author: Travis Duke

customer_reviews.title: Missing Cover, trimmer line keeps stretching Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Package was missing a cover and the trimmer string would keep stretching, which you could easily get hit and injured with. You can’t fix that problem so it is not safe. I hope Amazon can fix this problem and help us get this settled.
customer_reviews.author: Yilin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good combo
customer_reviews.text: The weed wacker and blower combo is what I needed. Everything works fine and dandy. One downfall is the battery life didn't last as long as I thought it would and the charging to full bar takes way too long even when I had the fast charging. Overall I give it 4 stars, one less star for the battery life being too short, good thing it comes with 2 interchangeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Good Performer
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I first unboxed this, as it was more of a light weight than I was expecting. I almost returned it, but my wife wanted to keep it to replace her old corded light duty trimmer. I decide to try it out on our back hillside, and was pleasantly surprised. It cut through some pretty tall field grass well, had very good battery life and used very little line. It's light weight was easy on my torn rotator cuff. It won't likely replace a gas trimmer for those larger jobs, but this is a great choice for touch ups and smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: golfdog541

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: This works well. I replaced my electric one with this because I needed very long cable and was cumbersome. It's not as powerful as the electric one but does the job. Little quieter than electric one I had but probably due to less torque, but I am okay as it gets the job done. I bought with two batteries so I have them both charged and ready. When I purchased mine, Worx offered spool for life for free. Spools are shorter but when I ran low, I ordered them and just paid for shipping. You get pack of 6. Shipping was around $10 so not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Constant dead battery
customer_reviews.text: The batteries literall take 4/5 hrs to charge and last 30 mins. Terrible product because of that issue alone.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brochu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - lightweight but Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I do have a small yard, with sidewalk , but plenty of trimming needed. One battery lasts long enough for me to do everything, at least 30 minutes. I haven't had to refill the string yet, and I hope that is easy. It was simple to put together, and I like that you can change it from trimmer to edger, even though it took me a bit to figure out how to do that. Another plus, is that it is lightweight and doesn't vibrate much. After using my old, corded trimmer, my arms would shake so much! Not so with this fine trimmer. It seems to be pretty tough too. Best one I've had so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Anykey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the average homeowner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use at her house. It is a typical 3 bedroom. Has a 4 stall barn on about an acre of land. I was worried about power and battery life but more worried about her taking care of and starting a gas powered one. Well this was more than I could have hoped for. It is not a professional landscaper item. It is a great homeowner model. She uses it on the driveway, house, sidewalk,and barn all with one of the two batteries it comes with. No gas to mix starts when she finally gets off her butt to do some work.
customer_reviews.author: Bliz

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to use is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not as strong as a gas weed trimmer, but definitely easier to maintain. Been using once a week for the last 2 months and no problems. Stringing is incredibly easy with the already strung spools. Didn’t give 5 stars because the battery life is decent at best (25min) and I feel like it can be better. Also the stock battery charger takes 4-5 hours to charge a completely dead battery which is ridiculous. Other then that I’m happy with my purchase and might even consider other WORX products in the future
customer_reviews.author: Nilson

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble starting a gas trimmer so this is a dream come true. Since it is electric I was expecting it to be pretty wimpy. However, it takes down tall weeds like a beast! I love it! The battery lasts a while, plus it comes with an additional battery so even when one runs out you can keep on going. The spools last a decent amount of time but are inexpensive. Plus, they are super easy to change out. The only thing I struggle with is figuring out which way to angle the head (since it is changeable) to trim vs. edge but I am pretty sure that is operator error! :)
customer_reviews.author: P S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This WORX trimmer surprised me! It worked great and was very powerful. It worked just as well as the 40volt battery trimmer that I returned to another retail story. BUT The Worx Trimmer is very lightweight and easy to use, unlike the one I returned. The only negative thing is the battery life. It lasts about 40 minutes. But since WORX tools has interchangeable batteries, it is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Aggravating weed eater
customer_reviews.text: The wheels that are supposed to assist you roll along the edge for a straight line first came off. The. A orange collar fell off & the worst part is that the spool holder comes offs & then the line gets tangled & ruined. I had to order 4 spool holders for this machine. They sure made the commercials for this product look amazing g but it is anything but. I’m planning on replacing this with an Ego weedeater. The issues of not working, falling apart with me swearing like a sailor is not worth the aggravation. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly powerful and long lasting trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of lawns to trimmer during the summer and I was looking for something better than what I had. The Worx Trimmer exceeds those expectations. The batter life is exceptionally long. I love how I can adjust the length of the trimmer from real short to long. The angle to trim is adjustable as well with just a few clicks and it's very simple to do. This trimmer is lightweight and durable. Taking out long grass is easy peasy too. I can't say enough about how good this trimmer is. I recommend it highly if you have lots of trimming to do.
customer_reviews.author: t winters

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Most string trimmers fail because the line does not advance. This one is very nicely done. The single string is stout and it will cut thru some fairly stout material. It is not as quick at cutting as the gas powered ones, but is lighter and easier to maneuver. The only negative I have found is the battery charger. It required over 5 hours per battery to charge each one. Fortunately a single battery will last long enough to trim most of my small yard and there's always the spare. Fairly well done for a $100 unit. I'd
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed. I waited 1.5 weeks for delivery on this. I used it today - front yard, edging, etc. and the battery ran out after about 15-20 minutes. That's ok - have three more... Took it in the back yard and was using the weed eater and then went to switch to edging I was trying to pivot the shield and it wouldn't budge. Now I don't have brute strength by any means - it just ripped off and now it's useless. This was my first time using it. I'm hoping I get my money back. I have other Works equipment - what a shame...
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Gallup

customer_reviews.title: Much improved...
customer_reviews.text: ...ver the version from many (9?) years ago which had a heavy battery that needed to be replaced constantly. I was dubious about buying this item again but all the upgrades make it very practical and it is still affordable. I like that it comes with two batteries because one never has enough power to do the whole yard.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning mom of four

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use-short battery life
customer_reviews.text: It's super lightweight and easy to use. The instruction book is written in illustrations and a few words, which was really weird. The battery takes 5 hrs to charge, but only 20-40 minutes to discharge. I prefer things that take 1 hr to charge & keep things working 8 hrs or more. I also thought I'd be able to interchange the batteries between my WORX PowerShare 12" Cordless String Trimmer & Edger,Lawnmower, and my WORX Lawnmower. This battery is 1/3 the size of the lawnmower battery.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca of SunnyBrook

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and a decent value.
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind a having a cord on a lawnmower, because you are basically just going back and forth on your lawn, but on a trimmer that needs to be maneuvered, I did not want to have anything pulling as I move around. and a motorized one is a hassle, and weighs more. The cordless option was the way to go. this bundle with charger and 2 batteries is a really good deal. I have used it once, and it worked great. I had a lot of weed overgrowth in my back yard, the string feeder worked good as well. so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Weed eater/ edger totally defective.
customer_reviews.text: Weed eating on my lawn. First use. The unit stops after a few seconds and does this continuously. I am following the instructions to the letter and cannot keep the unit running. Per the Troubleshooting guide the motor is defective. I wish to return the unit for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Wellin

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of practice if you love a crisp edge
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer due to my neighbor’s high recommendation. His sidewalk has the crisp edge I wasn’t getting from my current trimmer. Well, I haven’t been able to get this edge! Additionally, it’s extremely difficult to turn the head on the trimmer to go from trimming to edging and back. One excellent feature is that the battery lasts for a long time. I trimmed the whole yard and the following week was still able to get some use prior to needing to recharge. The weight seems comparable to my current trimmer though the battery is lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Great electric trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works well in my yard. The battery life is great and they recharge quickly. It is lighter weight than my former gas trimmer and a much lower noise level. It is easy to replace pre filled string line pods. Easy fold up for storage. The Worx name made it an easy purchase and I am happy with this product. Be advised this trimmer will not handle very long or thick grass easily but if you use it regularly it will handle your trimming with little problem. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: EA Poe

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am a newly single female that has never mowed a lawn, let alone edged before. Gas appliances and machinery scare me to death, so this battery powered edger seemed like the best option for me. I'm an idiot when it comes to putting things together... but this product was super easy to understand, and I feel super confident when using it! I have a small front and backyard so the battery will usually last me 2-3 uses before I have to change it, totally not a big deal at all! I absolutely love this product and would buy it again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi B.

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't For Me
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer did not work for me; the battery didn't last long at all. I have a big front and back yard and I felt it was not powerful enough to get the job done. Also, one of the features I thought was ideal was the wheel for edging, but that didn't work well for me either. I couldn't see the edge of the sidewalk to get that neat straight clean cut line I love. I'm sure lots of people are happy with this trimmer but I had to keep looking for a stronger more powerful trimmer/edger combination.
customer_reviews.author: VanStepp77

customer_reviews.title: I find this string trimmer awkward.
customer_reviews.text: I find this string trimmer rather awkward to use. I can only hold one handle and my other hand has to be on the stem (?) of the unit otherwise I cannot control it very well. The biggest thing about it that I don't like is that it uses the string up pretty fast and I find that I have to continually hit the button to lengthen the string as it seems to get eaten up pretty fast. I was rather disappointed because I was hoping for something better than my previous string trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: CD

product_meta.title: WORX WG163 GT 3.0 20V PowerShare 12" Cordless String Trimmer & Edger, 12in
product_meta.description: Style:w/ 2x20V Batteries & Reg ChargerThe 2-in-1 GT quickly converts from a trimmer to an in-line wheeled edger and back again. So save your money and don’t buy a separate trimmer and edger. The Command Feed spool system gives you line when you want it at the press of a button. And press all you want because the GT comes with Free Spools for Life! The rubberized wheels provide traction and support for even, professional looking lines when you’re edging. And the head tilts 90° so you can trim on uneven patches of lawn. The adjustable spacer guard keeps you from whopping the tops off of flowers and plants. And at only 5.3 lbs. you can get your trimming and edging done without feeling fatigue from it. Two powerful 20V Power Share batteries are included with this purchase, which you can use on any tool on the WORX Power Share platform.
feature_bullets: Trimmer & edger 2-in-1: Easily converts from a string trimmer to a wheel edger in just seconds
Instant line feed: Innovative push button command feed spool system for instant line feeding. Plus, free spools for life
Batteries included: 2 powerful and lightweight 20V Power Share MaxLithium batteries come with this tool and can be used on any other tool in the WORX PowerShare family
Head tilts 90°: So you can trim and edge on sloped terrain, and get to tough-to-reach places
Do it all with the same battery: Do it all with WORX PowerShare, the only cordless tool platform that uses the same battery to power 20V and 40V tools
Rubberized wheels: Support and guide the edger, giving you straighter lines and cleaner cuts
Spacer guard: Adjustable, so you don’t damage plants, landscape features, and lawn ornaments while you’re trimming
Specs: 7600 rpm no-load speed, 12” cutting diameter, 5.3 pounds machine weight, 10’ cutting line length, 0.065” line diameter
Includes: 20V trimmer & edger, (2) 20V MaxLithium battery, 20V charger, trimmer spool, support wheels, safety guard

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,529 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
